item.description: 1. Why would you use OOP in R? Object oriented programming in R is unfortunately rather complicated comparing to Python (which seems to be the only reasonable alternative for data science programming). However, there are certain cases when OOP may come up helpful: when you write your own package and you want users to work on an object that your function returns (print, summary, plot); learning OOP in R is a good investment, because it letâ€™s you understand better how functions like print, plot etc.
